reporting-org.narrative: Bundesministerium für wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung (BMZ)
Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)

title.narrative: Municipal Climate Protection Program (Chernivtsi) - Ph. 2 Accompanying Measures

description.narrative: Die Infrastruktur für Wasser- und Abwasserversorgung in der ukrainischen Stadt Chernivtsi ist stark veraltet, was sowohl zu hohen Wasserverlustquoten als auch vergleichweise hohen Betriebskosten führt. Im Rahmen des "Kommunalen Klimaschutzprogramms" wird über mehrere Phasen hinweg die Trinkwasserversorgung und Abwasserentsorgung in der Stadt Chernivtsi im Südwesten der Ukraine rehabilitiert und modernisiert. Modulziel ist die Sicherstellung einer nachhaltigen, kontinuierlichen und verbrauchsorientierten Trinkwasserversorgung sowie die Gewährleistung einer umweltverträglichen, nachhaltigen Abwasserentsorgung und Abwasserbehandlung. Um einen nachhaltigen Betrieb sicherzustellen, werden die technischen und wirtschaftlichen Kapazitäten des kommunalen Versorgungsunternehmens im Rahmen der hier aufgeführten Begleitmaßnahme durch Beratung gestärkt. Zielgruppe ist die gesamte Bevölkerung der Stadt Chernivtsi (ca. 265.000 Einwohner). Darlehensnehmer ist das Ministerkabinett der Ukraine, vertreten durch das Finanzministerium. Projektträger ist Chernvitsi Vodokanal (CVK). ŒDie Gesamtkosten des Programms werden auf rd. EUR 76,5 Mio. geschätzt. Davon wurden in Phasen I (Gesamtkosten: EUR 23,0 Mio.) EUR 17 Mio. als FZ-Darlehen finanziert. Zur Finanzierung von Begleitmaßnahme und Durchführungsconsultant für Phase I werden Zuschussmittel i.H.v. EUR 3,0 Mio. aus der Neighbourhood-Investment-Facility (NIF) der EU eingesetzt. Œ

The water and wastewater supply infrastructure in the Ukrainian city of Chernivtsi is severely outdated, resulting in both high water loss rates and comparatively high operating costs. As part of the "Municipal Climate Protection Program", the drinking water supply and wastewater disposal system in the city of Chernivtsi in southwestern Ukraine is being rehabilitated and modernized over several phases. The module objective is to ensure a sustainable, continuous and consumption-oriented drinking water supply and to ensure environmentally sound, sustainable wastewater disposal and treatment. To ensure sustainable operation, the technical and economic capacities of the municipal utility are strengthened through advisory services as part of the accompanying measure listed here. The target group is the entire population of the city of Chernivtsi (approx. 265,000 inhabitants). The borrower is the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine, represented by the Ministry of Finance. The project executing agency is Chernvitsi Vodokanal (CVK). ŒThe total cost of the program is estimated at around EUR 76.5 million. Of this amount, EUR 17 million was financed as FC loans in Phase I (total costs: EUR 23.0 million). Grant funds in the amount of EUR 3.0 million from the Neighborhood Investment Facility (NIF) of the EU are being used to finance the accompanying measure and the implementation consultant for Phase I. Œ
Programm zur Modernisierung und Rehabilitierung kommunaler Infrastruktur

The water and wastewater supply infrastructure in the Ukrainian city of Chernivtsi is severely outdated, resulting in both high water loss rates and comparatively high operating costs. As part of the "Municipal Climate Protection Program", the drinking water supply and wastewater disposal system in the city of Chernivtsi in southwestern Ukraine is being rehabilitated and modernized over several phases. The module objective is to ensure a sustainable, continuous and consumption-oriented drinking water supply and to ensure environmentally sound, sustainable wastewater disposal and treatment. To ensure sustainable operation, the technical and economic capacities of the municipal utility are strengthened through advisory services as part of the accompanying measure listed here. The target group is the entire population of the city of Chernivtsi (approx. 265,000 inhabitants). The borrower is the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine, represented by the Ministry of Finance. The project executing agency is Chernvitsi Vodokanal (CVK). ŒThe total cost of the program is estimated at around EUR 76.5 million. Of this amount, EUR 17 million was financed as FC loans in Phase I (total costs: EUR 23.0 million). Grant funds in the amount of EUR 3.0 million from the Neighborhood Investment Facility (NIF) of the EU are being used to finance the accompanying measure and the implementation consultant for Phase I. Œ

title.narrative: Für dieses Vorhaben liegt kein Eintrag zur Umwelt- und Sozialverträglichkeit vor.
